Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis and we encourage you to apply early.About the Business Risk Integrated Control (BRIC) teamThe Business Risk Integrated Control (BRIC) team is missioned to:Protect users, including and beyond content consumers, creators, advertisers;Secure platform health and community experience authenticity;Build infrastructures, platforms and technologies, as well as to collaborate with many cross-functional teams and stakeholders.The BRIC team works to minimize the damage of inauthentic behaviors on platforms, covering multiple classical and novel community and business risk areas such as account integrity, engagement authenticity, anti spam, API abuse, growth fraud, live streaming security and financial safety (ads or e-commerce), etc.In this team you'll have a unique opportunity to have first-hand exposure to the strategy of the company in key security initiatives, especially in building scalable and robust, intelligent and privacy-safe, secure and product-friendly systems and solutions. Our challenges are not some regular day-to-day technical puzzles -- You'll be part of a team that's developing novel solutions to first-seen challenges of a non-stop evolvement of a phenomenal product eco-system. The work needs to be fast, transferrable, while still down to the ground to making quick and solid differences.ResponsibilitiesProvide risk assessment and risk solution plans for different products and businesses, promote the implementation of relevant plans, and ensure the safe development of TikTok, live broadcast, e-commerce and advertising business;Develop forward-looking risk control strategies through analyzing user behavior, content, user feedback and other data, drive the improvement and upgrade of product safety mechanism, and be responsible for the effect of risk solution plans;Cooperate with risk control RD, build and improve risk perception, identification, intervention and governance effect measurement system, and design common risk control products and services that can support different businesses;Conduct in-depth investigation into the changing trend of CIB networks in different countries, and be sensitive to the company's business and strategy; be able to discern new risk points from the industry and business trends, deploy risk control mechanisms in advance to prevent the occurrence of risks, and ensure that the risk control ability is at the leading level in the industry.QualificationsUndergraduate, or Postgraduate who is currently pursuing a degree/master in Computer Science, Information Security, Statistics, Mathematics or a related technical discipline;Interest in working on internet products, preferably in strategy, risk control or related fields;Strong sense of responsibility and team spirit, excellent learning ability, and goal-oriented;High curiosity and self-motivation, with a willingness to accept challenges and aim for the best.By submitting an application for this role, you accept and agree to our global applicant privacy policy, which may be accessed here: https://careers.tiktok.com/legal/privacy.

description: Position OverviewAutodesk's Forge team is looking for a passionate Intern Software Engineer. Our organizational ecosystem comprises of Cloud services. The Forge platform unlocks the functionality in Autodesk products that have been serving industries such as architecture, engineering, construction, manufacturing, media, and others. It is an opportunity to work on applications that directly impact the millions of users of Autodesk products.As a member of a team, your first role will be to contribute to the development of Forge platform APIs, which are the building blocks for next-generation design apps. You will be part of an agile product team of smart and highly motivated engineers building world-class cloud software applications and services. You will be offered guidance and direction by the Senior Engineers, especially while navigating through the technical challenges. You should be open to learn and work on any programming language.More information on Forge Data Management service and APIs: https://forge.autodesk.com/api/data-management-cover-page/ResponsibilitiesAn active member of a highly skilled and motivated agile development teamInvolved with all aspects of software development, working to create and maintain the most reliable, secure, performant and high throughput service for our customers by leveraging cloud technologyYou should be ready to wear multiple hats. Take responsibilities of a Software Developer, Quality Assurance engineer, and DevOps engineerCollaborate with software engineers and other stakeholders. As a member of an Agile development team, you will frequently be choosing yourself which tasks to work on, rather than being assigned work by someoneContribute to software design by leveraging cloud design patterns and build the cloud expertiseContribute to improvements in the processes and deliverables that increase the effectiveness and efficiency of the team in responding to customer and business needsDocument and present your ideas and solutions accurately and thoroughly.Minimum QualificationsStrong programming skills (any language)Strong problem-solving skills and capability to work on complex systemsAbility to operate effectively in a dynamic and fluid environmentStrong written and oral communication skills in EnglishPreferred QualificationsExposure to Cloud services like AWS platform would be a big plus.Experience with backend programming languages such as Java would be given a preference.Learning BenefitsExperience Agile (scrum) software development methodology through day to day workGain exposure to Cloud-based software architecture and technologies, familiarize oneself with different tools such as RESTful web services, GitHub, Jenkins, Splunk, Grafana, NewRelic, Cassandra, Titan etc.Acquire hands-on experience on software development, software test automation, code delivery process, continuous integrationWork with different roles and distributed teams globallyHone problem solving and communication skills.About AutodeskWith Autodesk software, you have the power to Make Anything. The future of making is here, bringing with it radical changes in the way things are designed, made, and used. It?€?s disrupting every industry: architecture, engineering, construction, manufacturing, and media and entertainment. With the right knowledge and tools, this disruption is your opportunity.Our software is used by everyone - from design professionals, engineers, and architects to digital artists, students, and hobbyists. We constantly explore new ways to integrate all dimensions of diversity across our employees, customers, partners, and communities. Our ultimate goal is to expand opportunities for anyone to imagine, design, and make a better world.At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law.Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk? Please search for open jobs and apply internally (not on this external site). If you have any questions or require support, contact Autodesk Careers.

qualification: Professional Certificate/NiTEC, Diploma, Advanced/Higher/Graduate Diploma, Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree
description: About Keysight:Keysight is on the forefront of technology innovation, delivering breakthroughs and trusted insights to the world?€?s visionaries and innovators in electronic design, test, manufacturing, and optimization. Our ~14,000 employees create world-class solutions in wireless communications, 5G, automotive, quantum, aerospace, defense, and semiconductor markets for customers in over 100 countries.We?€?re recognized as a Great Place to Work across the globe due to our robust culture and dynamic working environment. Our global team acts as ?€?One Keysight,?€? using collaboration, inclusivity, and integrity to advance technology. We?€?re driven and curious, and we value all ideas, especially bold ones. And our strong culture extends far beyond our own walls. We leverage our corporate social responsibility framework to support our communities, nurture the next generation of engineers, and promote environmental sustainability. Our technical solutions ?€? and our methods for creating them ?€? help connect and secure the world. Learn more about what we do and how we do it.About the Job:You will work as the lead engineer in a team of software engineers and electrical engineers developing EDA simulation software through the Keysight/PSS Project lifecycle (PLC) from Concept to Shipment. Your products focus on the signal integrity market, and you will be collaborating with other teams and working as a whole on our flagship product, the Advanced Design System (ADS).We are seeking an experienced RnD electrical engineer with strong CS skills, experience in programming, experience working with High Speed serial standards (USB, PCIe, etc.) and Memory Standards (DDR, HBM, etc.) and experience in a technically leading other team members.About the Team:PSS leads Keysight's growth in design-test workflow software, establishing Keysight as the undisputed leader in workflow solutions. The PSS product portfolio includes market-leading EDA and application-layer software test and measurement software, including ADS, SystemVue, GoldenGate, X-Apps, VSA, and Signal Studio. PSS is also driving the alignment of these products with Keysight's PathWave platform.Responsibilities:Technically lead teams to deliver quality products on time following the Agile software development process.Collaborate with multi-functional product development teams to deliver solutions that enhance and complement our overall Signal Integrity EDA flow.Lead by example and help grow a high-performance team and nurture a culture in software organization of quality, ownership, collaboration, continuous improvement, and data-driven decision making.The essential requirements of the job include:BS, or MS in CS or EE5yrs of experience in a technical software development role such as a software architect or senior softwareExpert working knowledge of C++ and OOPExcellent oral and verbal communication skillsExperience in modeling of signal and power delivery channels, and/or experience working on developing Analog EDA software toolsExperience in analysis of high-speed serial and/or DDR channelsGreat team player and willing to take on a variety of projects, customer issues, and quality fixesSolid understanding of Jenkins CI/CD development flows and impact of DevOps on architectureIt would be a plus if you also possess:Prior experience in developing EDA software toolsKnowledge of EDA tools and EDA flows

qualification: Professional Certificate/NiTEC, Diploma, Advanced/Higher/Graduate Diploma, Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree
description: ResponsibilitiesTikTok is the leading destination for short-form video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy.Our Trust & Safety team's commitment is to keep our online community safe. We have invested heavily in human and machine based moderation to remove harmful content quickly and often before it reaches our general community.Your wellbeing is very important to us. As part of this commitment, you will have access to our especially designed wellbeing programmes to support your physical and psychological health and wellbeing.As a Risk Analysis Intern in Trust & Safety, you will become our eyes and ears, researching and analyzing trends, industry changes, and public sentiment that could impact our products. You will be an influential voice, providing insights into public opinion and policy development to further enhance users' trust and safety.What will I be doing?Monitor and analyze public perception towards company products through analyzing news articles and social media sites, using open source research and third-party social listening tools.Conduct investigations on key events in Southeast Asia/Northeast Asia/South Asia, for example: elections, local and international eventsAnalyze and research social issues, online behaviours and archetypes to inform stakeholders of the risks towards Trust and SafetyProduce internal reports that analyzes public perception of Trust and Safety issues routinely.Research and analyze various regulatory information including but not limited to legislation and law enforcement for cyber security, data privacy and social media regulations at both federal and state level in Southeast Asia/Northeast Asia.QualificationsWhat should I bring with me?Undergraduate or graduate student with an educational concentration in Political Science, Journalism, Public Policy, Economics, International Relations, or a related fieldStrong in open-source research, and in digesting information succinctly for stakeholdersGreat communication skills and a strong sense of responsibility. Being able to deliver work quickly with high qualityAble to work independently with minimal supervisionBeing able to work at least 2 days or above per week. The internship duration is at least 3 monthsEnglish proficiency is required along with fluency in either Thai or Tagalog as you will be predominantly covering the Thai or Tagalog speaking market and would require to read and digest information in either Thai or TagalogTikTok is committed to the well-being of all our employees. Our promise is to provide comprehensive and evidence-based programs, to promote and support physical and mental wellbeing throughout each employee's journey with us. We believe that wellbeing is a relationship and that everyone has a part to play, so we work in collaboration and consultation with our employees and across our functions in order to ensure a truly person-centered, innovative, and integrated approach.TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We believe individuals shouldn't be disadvantaged because of their background or identity, but instead should be considered based on their strengths and experience. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

qualification: Not Specified
description: We are looking for outstanding students and recent graduates to join our Infrastructure team, with the opportunity for all high-performers to join as full-time Analysts. Our experience has shown that Interest and Passion indicate career success - far more than any specific subject qualification. With this in mind, we will train successful applicants, regardless of academic background, and help them develop their IT Infrastructure career with Millennium. Find out more about open roles, and hear from former interns and current analysts: ***************Job Function SummaryThe Infrastructure team is focused on the broken and the breakable. We obsess over how, when and why things fail. Whenever we see some beautiful new application or service, we immediately think of, and anticipate solutions for, the 1000 ways it can be broken or destroyed! Since no human can stay constantly vigilant, we build automated solutions to fix these problems. We rely on DevOps principles to build systematic pipelines that deliver artifacts free of human error.Our previous Millennium graduates have progressed into many different areas of specialty such as ?€??? Cyber Security?? Cloud Computing?? Database Administration?? Infrastructure Engineering / Architecture?? Network Engineering?? Software DevelopmentPrincipal ResponsibilitiesJunior engineers at Millennium start their journey as desktop support engineers. You will work as part of the Tech Support team to support the firm?€?s global users. This allows you to meet and work with all our different teams, and learn how the organization operates. You will work across all areas of technology support, both in the office, in the data center and AWS Cloud. You will learn how to identify when to escalate issues, and work with appropriate global tech teams to resolve problems. You must be able to work independently as needed, but understand how to work well with the wider team.As you work on issues, you will be mentored in a wide range of technologies, and problem solving methods. You will be working with a strong team of smart, and hardworking colleagues. As your interests specialize, you will receive advanced training in any area of interest, and you will gain valuable experience of working in IT Infrastructure. As your career at Millennium progresses, opportunities will arise to specialize as an engineer within your new realm of expertise.Beneficial Skills (We train from scratch, but these skills would help)?? Project management, ownership of problems, and a track record of strong attention to detail.?? Computer hardware internals - understanding how a computer is put together and how components interact both locally and over a network.?? Strong familiarity with Windows and/or Linux, ideally with familiarity of a command line shell like BASH or PowerShell.?? Knowledge of a programming language - ideally Python, Ruby or Golang.?? Network knowledge. E.g. Understanding how to debug why the internet is slow, beyond rebooting the router!Qualifications/Skills Required?? Degree or Postgraduate holder with Major in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related field?? Great problem solving and analytic skills?? Strong written and verbal communication skills?? Applicants must be able to commence full-time employment from November/December 2022 onwards, hence must possess a graduation date of Jan 2023 and before.*IMPORTANT NOTE: Please include your expected graduation date/month and earliest commitment date in your CV during applications. Failure to do so will result in longer processing time.-

description: Job DescriptionBe a part of a dynamic and diverse team that engineers large-scale, complex and resilient technology solutions that drive our global business. You're an integral part of one of the world's biggest tech companies. In 16 strategic technology locations worldwide, our team of more than 50,000 technologists design, build and deploy everything from enterprise technology initiatives to big data and mobile solutions, as well as innovations in electronic payments, cybersecurity, machine learning and cloud development. We partner with FinTech and Silicon Valley tech firms to deliver cutting-edge solutions to our clients and customers. CIB provides strategic advice, raises capital, manages risk, and extends liquidity in markets spanning over 100 countries around the world. CIB technologists develop solutions for a bank entrusted with holding $18 trillion of assets and $393 billion in deposits.Asset & Wealth Management (AWM)Serves institutional, high net worth, and retail clients. With client assets of $2.9 trillion and assets under management of $2.1 trillion, JPMC has one of the largest asset and wealth management divisions in the world. AWM Technology creates solutions to enable the AWM business to take care of clients' wealth and help clients get properly invested. AWM Technology is comprised of 4,600 agile technologists operating in a corresponding environment using a data-centric approach to develop innovative technology solutions.What Next?Join our world-class team by submitting your application through the careers website at jpmorgan.com/careers.Complete the online application form, attach your resume and cover letter.Once you submit your application, you will not be able to make changes to your application information.We encourage early applications as screening will be conducted on a rolling basis.

company: WWF-WORLD WIDE FUND FOR NATURE (SINGAPORE) LIMITED
qualification: Not Specified
description: Position Title: Sustainable Finance Palm Oil InternDepartment: Conservation (Global Palm Oil)Reports to: Global Palm Oil TeamLocation: SingaporeDate: 3 months/ 6 monthsAbout World Wide Fund for Nature, Singapore (WWF)WWF-Singapore is a Singapore-registered charity, a network member of WWF International ?€? one of the world?€?s largest and most respected independent conservation organisations. WWF-Singapore protects critical resources for people in Singapore by driving change across government, business, civil society and local communities. To meet key conservation goals, we address issues such as deforestation, haze pollution, seafood sustainability and illegal wildlife trade in Singapore and around the region. We deliver transformational corporate partnerships, fundraising to execute local and global conservation programmes and projects and community outreach to achieve WWF?€?s global goals for food, forests, oceans, water, wildlife, and climate and energy. As one of WWF?€?s global hubs, WWF-Singapore supports a global network that spans over 100 countries.WWF?€?s vision is a future where all palm oil is produced without causing deforestation, peatland and environmental degradation or harming wildlife, where workers are treated fairly, and communities' rights are respected, and producers including smallholder farmers have access to tools for responsible production and access to benefit from the market for responsible palm oil.WWF?€?s goals for palm oil are to:Protect: Wildlife and the environment is protected from expansion, and palm oil driven deforestation and natural habitat conversion is haltedProduce: Production is sustainable in resilient and biodiverse landscapes, no longer contributes to climate change, and the industry provides sustainable livelihoods, reduces poverty and respects human rightsRestore: The industry becomes a driver for wildlife conservation and restoration efforts, ensuring that landscapes with palm oil are healthy and livingMajor Functions:Sustainable finance is an important instrument in driving stakeholders across the value chain towards WWF?€?s sustainable palm oil agenda. To do this, we work with key finance sector players including banks, investors, regulators, and stock exchanges. As a sustainable finance intern within the global palm oil team, you will be doing research and building business case studies on the good practices within the financial institutions on sustainable palm oil policies and tools. In the course of the project, you will be working closely with members of the Global Palm Oil Team, Asia Sustainable Finance Team and WWF offices around the world to build upon your work.Major Duties and Responsibilities:Conduct relevant literature review and analysis of the sustainable finance market related to the palm oil industry (including but not limited to Bankable Nature-Based Solutions, Regenerative Agriculture, Net Zero targets of companies & governments and Climate Change)Stakeholder Mapping of FIs and banks in priority markets based on findings from the WWF?€?s finance flow study and researchLinking sustainable finance to regulations of central banks and financial regulatorsManage research on palm oil supply chains, ESG issues and other sustainable finance related topics; design internal briefs and presentations for WWF officesPrepare workshop materials ?€? presentation slides and case studiesPerform other related duties as needed to ensure the efficient and effective functioning of the teamRequired Qualifications and Skills:Degree curriculum, in either finance, economics, sustainable development, or environment managementMasters in finance or economics is preferredA good understanding of how environmental concerns relate to material business risks and opportunitiesGeneral knowledge of the finance sector levers for change as they relate to sustainabilityStrong written and verbal communication skills in English, along with the maturity to work in a global, multi-cultural environmentFlexibility and ability to work on other projects as neededStrong research, analytical and data management skillsGood organisational skillsThis job description covers the main tasks. Other tasks may be assigned as necessary according to organisational needs.We may also disclose personal data about you to our affiliates in the network in order to manage our relationship with you.Interested candidates are required to submit their cover letter and resume to the HR Department of WWF-Singapore (Email: **@wwf.sg). job_title: (Future Positions - Campus) Global Banking - Global Liquidity and Cash Management Summer Internship Programme (Asia Pacific - Singapore)
qualification: Not Specified
description: Global Liquidity and Cash Management InternshipWhether your degree relates to finance, science or the arts there is a place for you on our Global Banking Graduate Programme. Your skills and fresh ideas will help you establish an exciting career in a Corporate Banking, Investment Banking or Global Liquidity and Cash Management role.For: Penultimate year undergraduatesDuration: 5 to 16 weeks (depending on programme and country or territory)Areas: Global Liquidity and Cash ManagementStart date: May 2023 onwardsOverviewLearn how we support corporate clients, financial institutions, and the public sector to manage their working capital, optimise returns on surplus funds, and enhance their treasury efficiency.What you?€?ll doYou?€?ll work with different teams to support clients ranging from small local businesses to large corporations, banks, and governmentsWe?€?ll help you develop expertise in product development, meeting clients, business, and risk management with one of the following teams: Sales, Product Management, Client Management, Business Management, and the Chief Control Office.You?€?ll be responsible for supporting strategic initiatives as part of a larger workstream. And you?€?ll learn about HSBC?€?s products as you create internal presentations and support senior leaders.Top performers will be considered for our Global Liquidity and Cash Management Graduate Programme, which will provide you with future career prospects in transaction banking.Who you areYou want to learn about optimising returns for clients and how banks support customers in their treasury and working capital management. The evolving trends in transaction banking and innovation in financial technology interest your curiousity.You?€?re a proactive self-starter, keen to learn and take advantage of opportunities to do so. You?€?re also a team player with a collaborative attitude who builds trusted relationships and is driven by results.You?€?re familiar with PowerPoint and can use Excel to manage and analyse data, and you want to improve your skills in these and other software and systems.What you?€?ll learnYou?€?ll start with an induction to introduce you to banking, followed by sessions that provide understanding of corporate treasury, working capital management, and cash management fundamentals. You?€?ll also receive training on soft skills such as communication, networking, time management and personal branding.We?€?ll show you how technology is transforming treasury management through AI, Distributed Ledger Technology, API, Cloud Services, and Robotic Process Automation. And you?€?ll learn about transaction banking regulatory environment frameworks, our product suites, and our client-centric approach.The products you?€?ll learn about are:Liquidity and Investments products ?€? these enable clients to optimise balance sheets, maximise returns and streamline treasury processes. Some examples are Demand and Term Deposits, Notional Pooling and Cash Concentration, Liquidity Management Dashboard, and Cashflow Forecasting.Payments ?€? these enable the collection and disbursement of funds for clients, domestically and across borders, and provide other value-adding services like Real-Time Payments, Virtual Accounts and Omni Channel collections.Cards ?€? these enhance the visibility and control of client?€?s expenditures, such as with Business and Purchasing Cards.You?€?ll also receive training specific to the team you?€?re placed in, for example, in Payments you?€?ll learn about the SWIFT network and how banks communicate with one another.You?€?ll work with the suite of Microsoft Office tools and develop strong Excel and PowerPoint skills, along with confidence in managing stakeholders and your time. You?€?ll also gain in-depth technical knowledge about transaction banking.You?€?ll have plenty of opportunities for continuous learning and people to support you during your time with us so that you?€?re well prepared for your future.Singapore - HSBC Bank Singapore - Global Liquidity and Cash ManagementRequirements: You will have obtained or will be working towards a GPA of at least 4.0 / 5.0 or 3.2 / 4.0 (as appears on your official university transcript or degree certificate), or overseas equivalent to this. You are fluent in English. Please note that you can only make one application each recruitment cycle. Candidates should make an informed decision before applying by reviewing the different business areas and location sections on our website.Applications open: 15 August 2022Applications close: 14 November 2022Start date: May 2023 onwardsWe encourage you to apply for your programme of choice as soon as possible as we recruit on a rolling basis and may close applications before the advertised date if all vacancies are filled.-

qualification: Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree, Master's Degree
description: ResponsibilitiesTikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo.We are looking for talented individuals to join us for an internship in 2023. Internships at TikTok aim to offer students industry exposure and hands-on experience. Watch your ambitions become reality as your inspiration brings infinite opportunities at TikTokSuccessful candidates must be able to commit to the Summer Internship - 08 May 2023 to 28 July 2023 (12 weeks) period.We will prioritize candidates who are able to commit to the Summer Internship period. Please state your availability clearly in your resume (Start date, End date).Candidates can apply to a maximum of two positions and will be considered for jobs in the order you apply. The application limit is applicable to TikTok and its affiliates' jobs globally. Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis and we encourage you to apply early.Why Join UsAt TikTok, our people are humble, intelligent, compassionate and creative. We create to inspire - for you, for us, and for more than 1 billion users on our platform. We lead with curiosity and aim for the highest, never shying away from taking calculated risks and embracing ambiguity as it comes. Here, the opportunities are limitless for those who dare to pursue bold ideas that exist just beyond the boundary of possibility. Join us and make impact happen with a career at TikTok.About the Business Risk Integrated Control (BRIC) teamThe Business Risk Integrated Control (BRIC) team is missioned to:Protect users, including and beyond content consumers, creators, advertisers;Secure platform health and community experience authenticity;Build infrastructures, platforms and technologies, as well as collaborate with many cross-functional teams and stakeholders.The BRIC team works to minimize the damage of inauthentic behaviors on our platforms, covering multiple classical and novel community and business risk areas such as account integrity, engagement authenticity, anti-spam, API abuse, growth fraud, live streaming security and financial safety (ads or transactions), etc.In this team you'll have a unique opportunity to have first-hand exposure to the strategy of the company in key security initiatives, especially in building scalable and robust, intelligent and privacy-safe, secure and product-friendly systems and solutions. Our challenges are not some regular day-to-day technical puzzles - You'll be part of a team that's developing novel solutions to first-seen challenges of a non-stop evolution of a phenomenal product eco-system. The work needs to be fast, transferrable, while still down to the ground to make quick and solid differences.ResponsibilitiesBuild rules, algorithms and machine learning models to respond to and mitigate business risks in products/platforms. Such risks include and are not limited to abusive accounts, fake engagements, spammy redirection, scraping, fraud, etc;Analyse business and security data, uncover evolving attack motion, identify weaknesses and opportunities in risk defence solutions, explore new space from the discoveries;Define risk control measurements. Quantify, generalize and monitor risk related business and operational metrics. Align risk teams and their stakeholders on risk control numeric goals, promote impact-oriented, data-driven data science practices for risks.QualificationsUndergraduate, or Postgraduate who is currently pursuing a degree/master in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Internet Security or related STEM majors;Proficiency in data/statistical analytical tools, such as SQL, R and Python;Ability to think and communicate critically, rigorously and concisely;Strong sense of ownership and urgency, proactive and skilful communication, ability to handle high complexity problems and cross-functional alignment while being consistently independent, objective and rational;Experience in academia or industry leading skills in online social/content platforms, online commercial or financial businesses, state-of-art machine learning theories and applications would be advantageous.TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.By submitting an application for this role, you accept and agree to our global applicant privacy policy, which may be accessed here: https://careers.tiktok.com/legal/privacy.If you have any questions, please reach out to us.

description: About Keysight:Keysight is on the forefront of technology innovation, delivering breakthroughs and trusted insights to the world?€?s visionaries and innovators in electronic design, test, manufacturing, and optimization. Our ~14,000 employees create world-class solutions in wireless communications, 5G, automotive, quantum, aerospace, defense, and semiconductor markets for customers in over 100 countries.We?€?re recognized as a Great Place to Work across the globe due to our robust culture and dynamic working environment. Our global team acts as ?€?One Keysight,?€? using collaboration, inclusivity, and integrity to advance technology. We?€?re driven and curious, and we value all ideas, especially bold ones. And our strong culture extends far beyond our own walls. We leverage our corporate social responsibility framework to support our communities, nurture the next generation of engineers, and promote environmental sustainability. Our technical solutions ?€? and our methods for creating them ?€? help connect and secure the world. Learn more about what we do and how we do it.About the Job:You will work as the lead engineer in a team of software engineers and electrical engineers developing EDA simulation software through the Keysight/PSS Project lifecycle (PLC) from Concept to Shipment. Your products focus on the signal integrity market, and you will be collaborating with other teams and working as a whole on our flagship product, the Advanced Design System (ADS).We are seeking an experienced RnD electrical engineer with strong CS skills, experience in programming, experience working with High Speed serial standards (USB, PCIe, etc.) and Memory Standards (DDR, HBM, etc.) and experience in a technically leading other team members.About the Team:PSS leads Keysight's growth in design-test workflow software, establishing Keysight as the undisputed leader in workflow solutions. The PSS product portfolio includes market-leading EDA and application-layer software test and measurement software, including ADS, SystemVue, GoldenGate, X-Apps, VSA, and Signal Studio. PSS is also driving the alignment of these products with Keysight's PathWave platform.Responsibilities:Technically lead teams to deliver quality products on time following the Agile software development process.Collaborate with multi-functional product development teams to deliver solutions that enhance and complement our overall Signal Integrity EDA flow.Lead by example and help grow a high-performance team and nurture a culture in software organization of quality, ownership, collaboration, continuous improvement, and data-driven decision making.The essential requirements of the job include:BS, or MS in CS or EE5yrs of experience in a technical software development role such as a software architect or senior softwareExpert working knowledge of C++ and OOPExcellent oral and verbal communication skillsExperience in modeling of signal and power delivery channels, and/or experience working on developing Analog EDA software toolsExperience in analysis of high-speed serial and/or DDR channelsGreat team player and willing to take on a variety of projects, customer issues, and quality fixesSolid understanding of Jenkins CI/CD development flows and impact of DevOps on architectureIt would be a plus if you also possess:Prior experience in developing EDA software toolsKnowledge of EDA tools and EDA flows

qualification: Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree, Master's Degree
description: ResponsibilitiesTikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo.We are now looking for talented individuals to join us for an internship in 2022 - people who want to inspire creativity and co-create the future with TikTok.Successful candidates must be able to commit to one of the following internship cycles below: -Summer Internship - 09 May 2022 to 29 July 2022 (12 weeks)Off-cycle Internship - 01 August 2022 to 16 December 2022 (20 weeks)We will prioritize candidates who are able to commit to the two above internship period.Please state your availability clearly in the comments section (Start date, End date).Candidates can apply to a maximum of two positions and will be considered for jobs in the order you apply. The application limit is firm and includes all TikTok/ByteDance jobs globally. Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis and we encourage you to apply early.About the Cloud Infrastructure teamOur Cloud Infrastructure team is primarily responsible of the infrastructure and technical architecture. We are the bottom layer of the company's technologies, supporting all of our core products and business lines (including TikTok, Douyin and Toutiao), serving hundreds of millions of users every single day.In our team, you will develop and work on next-generation infrastructure technologies. We design and build fast, scalable, reliable and efficient systems that can support industry leading volumes and highly dynamic workloads - reaching millions of people across the world.You will tackle world-class challenges in distributed computing, large-scale system design, mass data storage, orchestration & scheduling, messaging middleware, etc.You can also expect to work within a highly talented and diverse team, motivated to solve the world's toughest technical challenges. Joining our team, you will be put through a structured and effective training and mentoring plan that is focused on your personal and technical development.If you are someone aiming for high, enthusiastic about tackling the world-class hard problems in technology, and enjoy working in a highly-collaborative and diverse environment, this would be the right place for you!ResponsibilitiesEngage in projects that relate to the underlying infrastructure and technical architecture for all mid-platform and business lines, including but not limited to distributed storage, big-data computing, orchestration & scheduling, as well as messaging middleware;Participate in the development of products such as large-scale PaaS services, DevOps platforms, R&D infrastructure for cloud-native, mass data storage systems, and distributed computing systems.QualificationsUndergraduate or Postgraduate currently pursuing a degree/master in software development, computer science, computer engineering, information systems or a related technical discipline;Strong interest in computer science and internet technology;Proficient in at least one general programming language (e.g. Java, C, C++, Golang, Python, etc.);Excellent communication skills with a strong thirst for knowledge and a keen desire to learn.By submitting an application for this role, you accept and agree to our global applicant privacy policy, which may be accessed here: https://careers.tiktok.com/legal/privacy.

qualification: Primary/Secondary School/O Level, Higher Secondary/Pre-U/'A' Level, Professional Certificate/NiTEC
description: ResponsibilitiesTikTok is the leading destination for short-form video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. Our Trust & Safety team's commitment is to keep our online community safe. We have invested heavily in human and machine-based moderation to remove harmful content quickly and often before it reaches our general community.The Enablement team aims to be the strategic partner of T&S, driving collaboration, optimization, and synergy for T&S global functioning, whereas other T&S functions fight at the frontline for content integrity and community safety. We facilitate the application of smooth cross-functional/cross-region/cross-culture corporations, support, and training, and drive change initiatives for leadership within the organization so that they fight with maximum efficiency and sustainability.The L&D team serves business development through skill-set building from a talent development perspective; helps and accompanies employees' individual development during different stages of their career;We?€?re looking for a L&D effectiveness intern to join our Learning and Development (L&D) team. This role will play a critical role in the way the L&D team demonstrates its success and helps with the reporting of our programs . The ideal candidate is a great communicator, good with data and simplifying data for audiences and using effective data storytelling to deliver key insights.Job RequirementsInterested in helping shape the strategy for assessing the effectiveness and impact of L&D on Business and Career development, using a data-driven approach;Assists with industry research on how to measure the success of an L&D function;Assists with defining the new measures of success for the global L&D function by working closely with L&D, HR and data teams;Undertakes reporting and dashboarding tasks from the L&D function and different L&D programs and creates effective reports;Assists with User Experience research and interviews to help understand the effectiveness of the learning program;Creates and strategises development of new data visualisation formats to show impact of L&D on Business performance (by leveraging data tools);Helps automate and streamline the process of reportingQualificationsIdeally a 3rd year student;Can work at least 3 days a week from August 2022 to December 2022;Preferably a degree in a field emphasizing analyzing, displaying, or reporting on people related data in organizations e.g., industrial/organizational psychology, behavioural economics, organizational behavior, economics, statistics, data analytics;English proficiency;Has a good foundational knowledge of data collection (surveys), analysis and visualisation softwares (e.g., Tableau), and Excel (e.g., VLOOKUP, pivots);Knowledge of producing good reports using tools;Analytical, proactive, responsible, and good communicator in a team setting environmentTrust & Safety is committed to the wellbeing of all our employees. Our promise is to provide comprehensive and evidence-based programs, to promote and support physical and mental wellbeing throughout each employee's journey with us. We believe that wellbeing is a relationship and that everyone has a part to play, so we work in collaboration and consultation with our employees and across our functions in order to ensure a truly person-centred, innovative and integrated approach.TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.ApplyShare to

description: Driving strategy through financial analysisDeepen your understanding of the firm, while learning how we operate, generate revenue and manage expenses when you join our global finance and business management team. You?€?ll support specific lines of business or our corporate function, working on projects that directly affect the firm?€?s bottom line alongside our top-tier professionals.Because you?€?ll be analyzing results and providing insights to business leaders to help make decisions on how we do business, we welcome your diverse thoughts and perspectives from day one. You?€?ll combine sophisticated analysis methods, accurate reporting and financial discipline to ensure the firm is capable of navigating all types of market environments, while maintaining a fortress balance sheet.What You'll DoWhile your responsibilities will vary based on the role, you will help identify, escalate and mitigate business risks, learning what it takes to be a trusted business advisor. You?€?ll optimize business performance by working on key initiatives, creating financial statements and controls, and working on regulatory issues.You?€?ll help generate meaningful analysis and reporting, coordinate with partners across the firm to provide strategic advice, generate budgets and forecasts, and contribute to large-scale projects across businesses. Start gaining the skills you need for a wide-ranging and rewarding career that can take you in any direction.Who We're Looking ForValued qualitiesWe are looking for highly motivated individuals with a passion for producing financial analyses to help drive strategic business decisions and the flexibility to work on many different types of projects. If you have excellent leadership, interpersonal and communications skills and thrive in working in a collaborative, dynamic environment, then this is the role for you.Key skillsYou should have a basic understanding of financial statements, accounting procedures, internal and external reporting and variance analysis. We?€?re looking for those with well-rounded academic backgrounds with a strong interest in financial management. Those who are analytical, curious leaders with a passion for critical thinking and working as part of a community to shape the future will thrive on the many opportunities available here.What We OfferYou?€?ll spend 10 weeks working on critical initiatives for executives, supporting public filings and learning what it takes to close the books for the month or quarter. Since finance and business management is ingrained in each of our businesses, you?€?ll gain exposure across the firm.On-the-job experienceYou?€?ll spend the summer working with a team on various initiatives that drive key business results,??such as: preparing external reporting to meet requirements, gathering internal and external data, financial budgeting or forecasting.TrainingThe program begins with a one-day orientation. You?€?ll then have access to various senior executives via our speaker events, mentors and training throughout the summer to increase your technical and soft skills.Career ProgressionAfter completing the program, many Analysts receive full-time employment offers.

description: Quantitative Analytics ProgramDevelop solutions that drive industry innovationOur mission is to develop and maintain sophisticated mathematical models, cutting-edge methodologies, and infrastructure to value and hedge financial transactions ranging from vanilla flow products to high and low-frequency trading algorithms.What You'll DoSpend your internship working alongside our top tier professionals, driving innovation through financial engineering, derivatives modeling, asset and liability management and risk management. You'll help develop or validate mathematical models, methodologies and tools used throughout the firm while gaining in-depth insight into the world of risk modeling, investment banking and the financial services industry.Throughout the application process, you will have an opportunity to learn about the diverse group of teams across the firm hiring through the Quantitative Analytics program. Interns will be placed in a role based on their background and professional interests. Some of these opportunities include:Quantitative Research: Develop and maintain sophisticated mathematical models, cutting-edge methodologies, and infrastructure to value and hedge financial transactions ranging from vanilla flow products to high and low-frequency trading algorithms.Model Risk Governance & Review: Work with model developers and the business to review and approve models for actual use and monitor performance for risk measurement.Treasury and Chief Investment Office: Best-in-class strategy and quantitative models for asset-liability management (ALM).Who We're Looking ForValued qualitiesWe are seeking colleagues with excellent analytical, quantitative and problem solving skills, as well as demonstrated research skills.Beyond that, we are most interested in are the things that make you unique: the personal qualities and outside interests and achievements beyond academia that demonstrate the kind of person you are and the difference you could bring to the team.Key skillsMastery of advanced mathematics (probability theory, stochastic calculus, partial differential equations, numerical analysis, statistics, econometrics) and/or the ability to programme using C++ or Python.Knowledge of options pricing theory, trading algorithms or financial regulations.??Strong verbal and written communication skills and the ability to present findings to a non-technical audience.What We OfferOn-the-job experienceYou'll be assigned a project that will help develop your analytics and coding skills, while learning the core fundamentals of financial engineering, derivatives modeling, risk management and in particular, machine learning.TrainingThrough hands-on work experience and training courses, you'll learn first-hand about market-sector specifics, building your technical skills and industry knowledge. You'll be supported by your teammates, tutors and mentors throughout the internship experience.Career ProgressionThe specialized knowledge and skills gained through the program will prepare you for a successful career at the firm. Top performing candidates may receive a full-time offer.

description: ResponsibilitiesTikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo.At TikTok, our people are humble, intelligent, compassionate and creative. We create to inspire - for you, for us, and for more than 1 billion users on our platform. We lead with curiosity and aim for the highest, never shying away from taking calculated risks and embracing ambiguity as it comes. Here, the opportunities are limitless for those who dare to pursue bold ideas that exist just beyond the boundary of possibility. Join us and make impact happen with a career at TikTok.Responsibilities:Design user experience of client solution product???Research performance ad optimization methodology & process, and further convert it into interpretable and actionable solutions for our users???Discover key requests from XFNs and target users, and adjust product strategies accordingly???Coordinate with different roles, including but not limited to UED, RD, QA to deliver high-quality product.QualificationsStudents pursuing a Bachelor?€?s / Master?€?s degree in Business, Analytics, Economics, Technology, Engineering or Information Systems;Willing to commit to at least 3 workdays a week; ready to start their internship program asap;Resourceful self-starter who is driven to learn on the job and deliver impactful outcomes;Technical and data analysis experiences are a major advantage.TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

description: Communication InternSingaporePosition DescriptionIntroduction??Service Market Logistics (SML) is part of Group Trucks Operations (GTO) within Volvo Group every day, we deliver world-class operational excellence to our customers based on intelligent logistic solutions. Our job is to develop, manage and optimize the Service Market supply chain for all Volvo Group brands and JV's. We strive for an innovative and diverse workplace, exercising the Volvo Group values with a high focus on customer success. GTO SML APAC Region covers the Service Market Business across India, China, Korea, Singapore, Australia, and Indonesia.??Meet your teamYou will join a passionate communication team and work closely with the SML APAC Communications Director, Singapore Communication Partner, and Managers. You will be part of a diverse SML APAC Communication Network!??Your Ideal Internship?You can gain experience with us with a very varied range of tasks "tailored" to your talents: editorial work, graphic design, delivering a video scenario, filming and editing yourself, a research assignment, the design and development of a communication plan from A to Z, a preparing a flashy business presentation, managing digital communication channels, helping to coordinate a company visit or event.....We invite you in current activities in the company to develop and organize the necessary communication for the different target groups via different channels (intranet, information screens, team meeting, newsletter...)Are we "the perfect match"?You are enthusiastic, curious, and creative.You are a flexible team player and easily interact with colleagues in various positions.You are a strong storyteller in word and image??You have very good language skills in EnglishYou can easily work with Office programsKnowledge of Adobe in design and Adobe Premier or other video editing programs is a plusAlmost convinced?As a communication intern at Volvo Group Service Market Logistic, you have the perfect internship opportunity to get to know our unique Swedish, Singapore, Volvo culture and how our company and all its departments work. Also, a nice bonus: during your internship, you can travel free with our company transport in the morning and evening to and from various pick-up points across Singapore to our office!Working hours: 8:30 am to 5:30 pm (Monday to Friday)Duration: 6 to 12 months; both full-time and part-time internship options are possible??About usThe Volvo Group drives prosperity through transport solutions, offering trucks, buses, construction equipment, power solutions for marine and industrial applications, financing and services that increase our customers?€? uptime and productivity. Founded in 1927, the Volvo Group is committed to shaping the future landscape of sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions. Countless career opportunities are offered across the group?€?s leading brands and entities that share a culture of Trust, Passion, High Performance, Change and Customer Success.??***************??A new era is here. Technologies such as big data, automation and artificial intelligence are changing the way we look at manufacturing and logistics. Volvo Group Trucks Operations is the organization responsible for truck manufacturing and logistics within the Volvo Group and is shaping future industries.Volvo Group Trucks Operations encompasses all production of the Group?€?s engines and transmissions as well as the production of Volvo, Renault and Mack trucks. The organization is also responsible for spare parts supplies to the Group?€?s customers and for designing, operating and optimizing logistics and supply chains for all brands. Together, Volvo Group Trucks Operations represents 30,000 employees at 30 plants and 50 distribution centers across the globe. Our global industrial footprint offers an opportunity for an international career in a state-of-the-art industrial environment, in which continuous improvement is the foundation. Join our teams as well!Auto req ID132719BROrganizationGroup Trucks OperationsState / ProvinceSingaporeCity/TownSingaporeEmployment/Assignment TypeInternship/Trainee/Co-opFunctional AreaMarketing & CommunicationLast application date10-Oct-2022-

We are a bunch of ambitious folks and we want to??create a place that you will want to show up for every single morning,??and create products that make you smile more.Join us in our mission to spread smiles across Asia!About The RoleYou will be part of the team that is building the best customer journey for the top smile cosmetics company in Southeast Asia. In this role, you?€?ll be responsible for the execution and planning of our CRM efforts - driving conversion, retention, engagement and reactivation with Zenyum.You will be supporting the CRM team in their strategy and execution of growth and retention initiatives such as crafting journeys and building automated CRM communication flows. qualification: Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree, Master's Degree
description: ResponsibilitiesTikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo.We are looking for talented individuals to join us! As an intern Engineer, you'll have the chance to work with our clients and teams to address key business problems and identify areas of growth for the company. You'll drive the development of the systems behind TikTok and work with other team members to inspire creativity and bring joy to users around the globe from day one.About TikTok Engineering teamYou'll have a unique opportunity to have first-hand exposure to building innovative, scalable and secure systems and solutions. You will play a key role in ensuring TikTok continues healthy growth and delivers the best product experience to all of our users to help them enjoy their time on TikTok.Potential TeamsIf you're looking for challenging ground to push your limits, here are some potential teams to kickstart your careerGlobal LivestreamingOur team focuses on delivering engaging and the best live streaming experience to global users. We develop creative and interesting features for streamers and viewers to express themselves and interact with others instantly.SocialTikTok Social team's mission is to facilitate meaningful user connections through TikTok's messaging experience. Our team drives significant user engagement and retention wins through fun, innovative, and technically sophisticated products and features. Some core features and components we build and maintain include User Profile, Story, Inbox, Messaging, Follow, Like, Comment, Tag, etc.Privacy & SecurityOur team aims to build a trusted platform by promoting privacy by design - we design architectures that treat user data respectfully, with transparency, and in line with reasonable practices. We build novel solutions to first-seen challenges of a non-stop evolution of a phenomenal product eco-system.Frontend + Web ArchitectureOur team builds and maintains the web products and infrastructure for TikTok, including www.tiktok.com, hybrid pages in the mobile app, and TikTok TV. Our goal is to build stable, sustainable, and reusable infrastructure, so that each product team can develop, test, and deploy their features more efficiently and effectively.TestingOur goal is to facilitate the successful release of TikTok features and enhancements from development to production through effective testing delivering continuous quality at speed. We own the entire system testing process, including but not limited to: analysis, design, executing test plans and cases, and conducting defect tracking.Stability and Quality teamThe Stability and Quality team is responsible for ensuring that the services provided by TikTok are highly reliable with low-latency. The team focuses on building and integrating software tools as solutions to improve system reliability, automation and scalability. The solutions include on-call monitoring, automated capacity planning, fault-tolerant business architecture and plans for intelligent failure recovery.QualificationsUndergraduate, or Postgraduate with a background in Software Development, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a related technical disciplineProficiency in coding & scripting languages such as C/C++, Java, Kotlin, Objective-C, Swift, JavaScript or PythonSolid understanding of computer science and strong problem solving skillsGood team communication and collaboration skillsPrior experience in mobile development (Android/iOS apps) is a plusBy submitting an application for this role, you accept and agree to our global applicant privacy policy, which may be accessed here: https://careers.tiktok.com/legal/privacy.Assessment process will primarily commence from Mid-August 2022.

It?€?s about being part of a purpose-led firm that builds trust in society and solve important problems. We help our clients to make informed decisions and operate effectively within them. At PwC, we are committed to making a difference for each other, our clients, and our community ?€? by empowering you to be the best version of yourself and investing in your growth. You?€?ll be able to develop as a leader, be well-connected, work in a great environment, explore our benefits and make a positive *************** PwC, you?€?ll ignite a meaningful career while being supported by a strong coaching and people-oriented culture, our Flex policies (Flex Space, Flex Dress and Flex Time), innovative learning and development programs (training programs, digital upscaling) as well as mobility opportunities. If you would like to be connected to like-minded individuals outside of work, we highly encourage you to be part of our people clubs and committees such as the Sports and Recreational Club, Toastmasters Club and more! description: TikTok is the leading destination for short-form video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy.Our Trust & Safety team's commitment is to keep our online community safe. Our technical solutions ?€? and our methods for creating them ?€? help connect and secure the world. Learn more about what we do and how we do it.About the Job:You will work as the lead engineer in a team of software engineers and electrical engineers developing EDA simulation software through the Keysight/PSS Project lifecycle (PLC) from Concept to Shipment. Your products focus on the signal integrity market, and you will be collaborating with other teams and working as a whole on our flagship product, the Advanced Design System (ADS).We are seeking an experienced RnD electrical engineer with strong CS skills, experience in programming, experience working with High Speed serial standards (USB, PCIe, etc.) and Memory Standards (DDR, HBM, etc.) and experience in a technically leading other team members.About the Team:PSS leads Keysight's growth in design-test workflow software, establishing Keysight as the undisputed leader in workflow solutions. The PSS product portfolio includes market-leading EDA and application-layer software test and measurement software, including ADS, SystemVue, GoldenGate, X-Apps, VSA, and Signal Studio. PSS is also driving the alignment of these products with Keysight's PathWave platform.Responsibilities:Technically lead teams to deliver quality products on time following the Agile software development process.Collaborate with multi-functional product development teams to deliver solutions that enhance and complement our overall Signal Integrity EDA flow.Lead by example and help grow a high-performance team and nurture a culture in software organization of quality, ownership, collaboration, continuous improvement, and data-driven decision making.The essential requirements of the job include:BS, or MS in CS or EE5yrs of experience in a technical software development role such as a software architect or senior softwareExpert working knowledge of C++ and OOPExcellent oral and verbal communication skillsExperience in modeling of signal and power delivery channels, and/or experience working on developing Analog EDA software toolsExperience in analysis of high-speed serial and/or DDR channelsGreat team player and willing to take on a variety of projects, customer issues, and quality fixesSolid understanding of Jenkins CI/CD development flows and impact of DevOps on architectureIt would be a plus if you also possess:Prior experience in developing EDA software toolsKnowledge of EDA tools and EDA flows

Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis and we encourage you to apply early.About the Business Risk Integrated Control (BRIC) teamThe Business Risk Integrated Control (BRIC) team is missioned to:Protect users, including and beyond content consumers, creators, advertisers;Secure platform health and community experience authenticity;Build infrastructures, platforms and technologies, as well as to collaborate with many cross-functional teams and stakeholders.The BRIC team works to minimize the damage of inauthentic behaviors on platforms, covering multiple classical and novel community and business risk areas such as account integrity, engagement authenticity, anti spam, API abuse, growth fraud, live streaming security and financial safety (ads or e-commerce), etc.In this team you'll have a unique opportunity to have first-hand exposure to the strategy of the company in key security initiatives, especially in building scalable and robust, intelligent and privacy-safe, secure and product-friendly systems and solutions. description: Driving strategy through financial analysisDeepen your understanding of the firm, while learning how we operate, generate revenue and manage expenses when you join our global finance and business management team. You?€?ll support specific lines of business or our corporate function, working on projects that directly affect the firm?€?s bottom line alongside our top-tier professionals.Because you?€?ll be analyzing results and providing insights to business leaders to help make decisions on how we do business, we welcome your diverse thoughts and perspectives from day one. You?€?ll combine sophisticated analysis methods, accurate reporting and financial discipline to ensure the firm is capable of navigating all types of market environments, while maintaining a fortress balance sheet.What You'll DoWhile your responsibilities will vary based on the role, you will help identify, escalate and mitigate business risks, learning what it takes to be a trusted business advisor. You?€?ll optimize business performance by working on key initiatives, creating financial statements and controls, and working on regulatory issues.You?€?ll help generate meaningful analysis and reporting, coordinate with partners across the firm to provide strategic advice, generate budgets and forecasts, and contribute to large-scale projects across businesses. Start gaining the skills you need for a wide-ranging and rewarding career that can take you in any direction.Who We're Looking ForValued qualitiesWe are looking for highly motivated individuals with a passion for producing financial analyses to help drive strategic business decisions and the flexibility to work on many different types of projects. If you have excellent leadership, interpersonal and communications skills and thrive in working in a collaborative, dynamic environment, then this is the role for you.Key skillsYou should have a basic understanding of financial statements, accounting procedures, internal and external reporting and variance analysis. We?€?re looking for those with well-rounded academic backgrounds with a strong interest in financial management. Those who are analytical, curious leaders with a passion for critical thinking and working as part of a community to shape the future will thrive on the many opportunities available here.What We OfferYou?€?ll spend 10 weeks working on critical initiatives for executives, supporting public filings and learning what it takes to close the books for the month or quarter. Since finance and business management is ingrained in each of our businesses, you?€?ll gain exposure across the firm.On-the-job experienceYou?€?ll spend the summer working with a team on various initiatives that drive key business results,??such as: preparing external reporting to meet requirements, gathering internal and external data, financial budgeting or forecasting.TrainingThe program begins with a one-day orientation. You?€?ll then have access to various senior executives via our speaker events, mentors and training throughout the summer to increase your technical and soft skills.Career ProgressionAfter completing the program, many Analysts receive full-time employment offers.

job_title: Regional Social and Cultural Studies (RSCS) Programme Intern
qualification: Not Specified
description: What the role isApplicants are invited for Internship at the Regional Social and Cultural Studies (RSCS) Programme. The RSCS programme studies and examines the history, sociology and anthropology of national and transnational processes within Southeast Asia. Specifically, RSCS is concerned with ethnographic practices and theory-building in the areas of contemporary histories, nation-building, ethnicity, religion, class and popular culture in the region.Key research areas are the processes of nation-building, civil society and religion, cultural globalisation and identity-making, contemporary politics, and democratisation and multiculturalism in Southeast Asia.What you will be working onJob Description: Project on Emerging Muslim Lifestyle in Southeast Asia After receiving appropriate training, the RSCS intern will be expected to participate in the following tasks:Assist Principal Investigator in his project Emerging Muslim Lifestyle in Southeast AsiaAssist in data collection and compilationAssist in preparation for an academic workshop in early NovemberAssist in preparation for a conference paperWhat we are looking forRequirementsThe intern is not required to have prior research experience.However, they will be expected to be possess good writing and presentation skills.University student with research interest on Islam in Southeast AsiaGood analytical, organizational, and writing skillsApplicants will be notified if they are shortlisted within 4 weeks of the closing date of the job posting. (Only short-listed candidates will be notified)-

description: TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo.We are now looking for talented individuals to join us for an internship in 2022 - people who want to inspire creativity and co-create the future with TikTok.Successful candidates must be able to commit to one of the following internship cycles below:Summer Internship - 09 May 2022 to 29 July 2022 (12 weeks)Off-cycle Internship - 01 August 2022 to 16 December 2022 (20 weeks)We will prioritize candidates who are able to commit to the two above internship periods.Please state your availability clearly in the comments section (Start date, End date).Candidates can apply to a maximum of two positions and will be considered for jobs in the order you apply. The application limit is firm and includes all TikTok/ByteDance jobs globally. Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis and we encourage you to apply early.About the Business Risk Integrated Control (BRIC) teamThe Business Risk Integrated Control (BRIC) team is missioned to:Protect users, including and beyond content consumers, creators, advertisers;Secure platform health and community experience authenticity;Build infrastructures, platforms and technologies, as well as to collaborate with many cross-functional teams and stakeholders.The BRIC team works to minimize the damage of inauthentic behaviors on platforms, covering multiple classical and novel community and business risk areas such as account integrity, engagement authenticity, anti spam, API abuse, growth fraud, live streaming security and financial safety (ads or e-commerce), etc.In this team you'll have a unique opportunity to have first-hand exposure to the strategy of the company in key security initiatives, especially in building scalable and robust, intelligent and privacy-safe, secure and product-friendly systems and solutions. Our challenges are not some regular day-to-day technical puzzles -- You'll be part of a team that's developing novel solutions to first-seen challenges of a non-stop evolvement of a phenomenal product eco-system. The work needs to be fast, transferrable, while still down to the ground to making quick and solid differences.ResponsibilitiesProvide risk assessment and risk solution plans for different products and businesses, promote the implementation of relevant plans, and ensure the safe development of TikTok, live broadcast, e-commerce and advertising business;Develop forward-looking risk control strategies through analyzing user behavior, content, user feedback and other data, drive the improvement and upgrade of product safety mechanism, and be responsible for the effect of risk solution plans;Cooperate with risk control RD, build and improve risk perception, identification, intervention and governance effect measurement system, and design common risk control products and services that can support different businesses;Conduct in-depth investigation into the changing trend of CIB networks in different countries, and be sensitive to the company's business and strategy; be able to discern new risk points from the industry and business trends, deploy risk control mechanisms in advance to prevent the occurrence of risks, and ensure that the risk control ability is at the leading level in the industry.QualificationsUndergraduate, or Postgraduate who is currently pursuing a degree/master in Computer Science, Information Security, Statistics, Mathematics or a related technical discipline;Interest in working on internet products, preferably in strategy, risk control or related fields;Strong sense of responsibility and team spirit, excellent learning ability, and goal-oriented;High curiosity and self-motivation, with a willingness to accept challenges and aim for the best.By submitting an application for this role, you accept and agree to our global applicant privacy policy, which may be accessed here: https://careers.tiktok.com/legal/privacy.
